'speaker_2': 'First, the ordinance would allow a council member each calendar year to remotely attend without a showing of cause up to five meetings of each council, standing committee and five meetings of the full council. 'speaker_2': 'defined to include the following five categories. First, an emergency as defined in the county code section 12.50 2.010. 'speaker_2': 'The third change that the ordinance would make is in the definition of urgent circumstances, and that change is is shown in the red lining on page 16 of your materials. 'speaker_2': 'It would not need to be so severe that travel to the meeting would pose an immediate life, health or safety risk to the member, which is the current standard. 'speaker_2': 'difficult for the member to attend the meeting. But it would not need to be an emergency and the member would not need to be unable to attend in person. 'speaker_2': 'And it is made clear that the death of a family member would fall within this ground for remote attendance.
